printChar.description: prints given character to stdout encoded as ASCII

printMessage.description: prints given C like string to stdout encoded as ASCII (NULL terminated)

printTerminator.description: prints an end of line character to stdout

printBin.description: prints given memory buffer bytes in binary format

printHex.description: prints given memory buffer bytes in hexadecimal format (big endian)

printInt.description: prints given integer value in decimal format

setDefaultColor.description: sets stdout default color to given one

printColored.description: in given color, prints given C like string to stdout encoded as ASCII (NULL terminated)

printUntil.description: prints a string until a specified character is encountered

igetLength.description: returns the length of a C like string (NULL terminated)

memcpy.description: copies given amount of bytes from src buffer to dest buffer

memset.description: sets all data in given range to given byte

sreadInput.description: reads up to 255 bytes from stdin into buffer

memcmp.description: compares two memory buffers for equality

fork.description: creates a child process to the process ran by
return: [#] process type identifer (when 0 executor is child process, else parent)

closeTerminated.description: closes terminated child processes since just calling exit is not enough

createSharedMemory.description: creates a shared memory segment with specified size
return: [#] shared memory ID or -1 on error

attachSharedMemory.description: attaches to a shared memory segment using its ID
return: [#] pointer to shared memory or -1 on error

strlen.description: returns the length of a C like string (NULL terminated)

sprintf.description: stores formatted print (%s) in given buffer. replaces each '%' with next param
params: [&?] optional string buffer (as many as you want, reverse order)

toString.description: takes the given 4 byte value and turn it into a string (base 10)

startswith.description: returns if string 1 starts with string 2 (assumes strlen(1) > strlen(2))

strstr.description: locates a substring within a string and returns a pointer to its start
return: [&] pointer to start of substring or NULL if not found

strcpy.description: copies the given string to the given location

newFile.description: creates a new file on disk with 777 perms given filename

writeFile.description: creates a new file and stores given string inside it

openFile.description: returns file descriptor given a path (or -1 if any error occur)

readFile.description: stores file contents given a file descriptor, location to store in and number of bytes

closeFile.description: closes a file given a file descriptor

deleteFile.description: deletes a file given a file descriptor

appendFile.description: appends the given string to the end of the file

iLengthFile.description: returns the length of a file in bytes, or -1 on error

unixNow.description: returns the current second in unix timestamp
params: [#] UTC+? - prodive a different timezone (ex: 2 for UTC+2)
return: [#] Unix timestamp for the executed second

timeYrMoDy.description: returns Year Month & Day given a unix timestamp

timeHrMinSec.description: returns Hour Minute & Second given a unix timestamp

timeFormatPrint.description: prints a formatted date/time string from a Unix timestamp

b64Encode.description: encodes a byte array into base64 format and stores it in a buffer

sha1.description: hashes the given bytearray using sha-1 (stores output in big endian)

addLen.description: adds the given length in bytes to the end of the chunk

functionF.description: internal sha1 function that calculates f(t;B,C,D)

constantsK.description: internal sha1 function that returns K(t) const based on t

digest.description: digests loaded chunk from before and returns the digest using last used h's values

sha1ResetH.description: resets the h's values to the default ones

makeChunk.description: creates a SHA1 chunk from a message by padding it according to the SHA1 specification

createSocket.description: creates a socket and returns its file descriptor
return: [#] a file descriptor for the socket

bindSocket.description: binds a socket to a port and a host

listenSocket.description: invokes listen on given socket with a max queue length of 10

acceptSocket.description: wait until a client has sent data to the socket

readSocket.description: reads the given socket file descriptor and stores its data in buffer

writeSocket.description: writes to the given socket file descriptor the given buffer

closeSocket.description: closes the given socket via its file descriptor

setNonBlocking.description: sets a socket to non-blocking mode

hasData.description: checks if a socket has data available to read

generateRequestStruct.description: creates a special struct from the parsed HTTP client request
params: [&] struct pointer (length must be above REQ_TOTAL_SIZE)

printStruct.description: prints a formatted debugging message based from the given struct
params: [&] struct pointer (length must be above REQ_TOTAL_SIZE)

parseHeaders.description: modifies request struct based on request headers
params: [&] struct pointer (length must be above REQ_TOTAL_SIZE)

printHeaders.description: parses and prints all headers with different color codes

getMethodType.description: returns the const of the const representing it from the string-like representation
return: [#] the const representing the method type, or -1 if method not found (for values, lookup: METHOD_GET / METHOD_POST / ...)

printReqFormatted.description: prints a log message for the given request

respondHttp.description: takes a client request struct and creates a response buffer
return: [#] length of full response in bytes

getResonseCodeStr.description: given a status code (number), return its string representation pointer
return: [&] buffer pointer pointing to the str representing given status code (EX: '200 OK')

getMime.description: returns the MIME type string for a given file extension

getExtension.description: returns a ptr to the start of the file extension (after the first '.')

wsSecAccept.description: given the sec-websocket-key and a buffer pointer, stores inside buffer the response
return: [&] pointer to the ws_buffer containing resulted auth result.

makeResponse.description: creates a WebSocket response frame with the given message (stored in wsRespBuff)

unmaskData.description: unmasks WebSocket data using the provided mask key

parseRequest.description: parses a WebSocket request frame and extracts the message
params: [&] callback function pointer (read sockes/readme.md for help)

create_database.description: creates a new database in shared memory with the specified size

append_data.description: appends data to the end of the database's linked list

create_users_database.description: creates a new users database with space for the specified number of users

create_user.description: creates a new user in the database with the given credentials

create_token.description: creates a unique token for a user based on their credentials and current time

get_usr_ptr.description: returns a pointer to a user's data in the database given their ID

get_user_count.description: returns the total number of users in the database

get_usr_by_token.description: finds a user in the database by their authentication token
return: [&] user data pointer or NULL if not found
